intro: Corchorus fuscus, commonly known as black knotweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Corchorus fuscus is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
